alert.note: Alert for Broome; Delaware (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Broome, west central Delaware and south central Chenango Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 305 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sanitaria Springs, or 9 miles east of Binghamton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sanford, Deposit, Windsor, Afton, Harpursville, Sanitaria Springs, Nineveh, Stilesville, Belden and Oquaga Creek State Park. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 78 and 79, and 81 and near 84. Interstate 88 between 4 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central New York.
